title.narrative: MNCH-HIV AND COVID

description.narrative: Health care institutions and front-line health workers have improved capacity to reach more vulnerable populations and deliver quality services for Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) (incl PMTCT), Pediatric HIV care and COVID case management, which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more children under 5 and women of reproductive age equitably access and utilize evidence-based health, HIV & nutrition interventions, including adoption of key behaviours, especially among vulnerable populations in most deprived states/regions, conflict-affected and peri-urban areas (Goal Area 1 UNICEF Strategic Framework 2018-2021)

participating-org.narrative: JHPIEGO CORPORATION AN AFFILIATE OF JOHN HOPKINS UNIVER
ROYAL COLLEGE OF PAEDIATRICS AND CHILD HEALTH RCPCH

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
